##Twenty-odd days of torture, my quarantine diary

WMSYGSDR

Function introduction, each line has the earnest person, again the ordinary person also has the extraordinary story. Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press Official non-fiction story platform, the story of the people will meet here.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
“

- In the event of an outbreak -

After the outbreak, who would you most like to see, what would you most like to do? I think the only people I want to see after the epidemic are my wife and daughter, and I want to take you by the hand and go to the city where I work and live, to have a bowl of hot and dry noodles, to take a walk on the road to Kong Hon, to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom.

”

“

- In the event of an outbreak -

After the outbreak, who would you most like to see, what would you most like to do? I think the only people I want to see after the epidemic are my wife and daughter, and I want to take you by the hand and go to the city where I work and live, to have a bowl of hot and dry noodles, to take a walk on the road to Kong Hon, to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom.

- In the event of an outbreak -

After the outbreak, who would you most like to see, what would you most like to do? I think the only people I want to see after the epidemic are my wife and daughter, and I want to take you by the hand and go to the city where I work and live, to have a bowl of hot and dry noodles, to take a walk on the road to Kong Hon, to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom.

”

18 January

On January 18, there was an editorial meeting in the morning, an annual meeting in the afternoon, and a performance. When the show was over, I jumped into a cab on my way home, packed my bags, and headed to Wuchang Railway Station, where I was waiting for my long awaited ride home.

I was talking to the taxi driver along the way, and out of nowhere, we hit upon a new case of coronary pneumonia far less severe than it was then. I asked the driver: Why don't you wear a mask, the driver said: Risk Relations, the news does not say that people do not pass on it? I took two patients to the hospital this morning?

I immediately became alarmed and asked the two patients whether they were sitting in the front seat or the back seat, whether they had coughed, how long they had waited, and how the driver had hit the taxi window as hard as he could.

After I got off the bus, I went to a drugstore and bought a bag of face masks. They were easy to buy and cheap. He took one out and put it on, and immediately his glasses were covered with a mist. Turns out I was wearing my mask the wrong way.

In fact, after the outbreak of the disease in the south China Seafood Market, I consciously wanted to buy a mask to wear, and my wife had told me, but the news at that time was "preventable and controllable" and "no one will pass on to another, " so I just kept going without buying one, and now I regret it. There were not many people wearing masks on the road, and everything was still in good order.

Then contact the car driver, unexpectedly the driver had already left, but had to let him help contact other cars. After a long wait, I finally got the call. I contacted a car from Hankou. I was told to wait. I was just glad to be home, but I didn't want the news that I was "from Hankou" to be a source of anxiety for me.

At eight o'clock that night, I returned to my mother in Law's House. We'll all be happy when we're all together.

This is my life and work as a resident of Wuhan and the entire course of action that day.

The Butterfly is quietly flapping its light wings.

January 20th

On this day, my cousin's youngest son had a full moon drink. In the evening, my wife and I sat around the stove, talking about our daughter's full moon drinks the day after tomorrow, Jan. 22, and swiped our cell phones. Suddenly brush a bombshell news, academician Zhong Nanshan says new coronary pneumonia exists"person-to-person"phenomenon. My wife and I immediately realized the seriousness of the situation, but since we had left Wuhan, the number of patients was far less than it is now, so we were not very alert. My wife and I joked that relatives and friends would not be allowed in the day after tomorrow without a mask, and that my mother in law would bring the doll's electronic body temperature gun, so one of us could take a temperature.

"Does it look like infernal affairs? " I said with a smile, and my wife gave me a blank look.

According to the plan, the next day with his mother-in-law to buy drinks, food and so on, get up in the morning to refresh the news, more and more feel the seriousness of the situation, a little do not want to go, "I knew all to the cook. " And still went to town with his mother-in-law.

Since I went out without a mask, I went to the drugstore and bought another pack. Luckily, it was easy to buy, and the price didn't go up.

To the vegetable market, that day a little intermittent rain, but can not stop people come to buy New Year's enthusiasm. Looking at the crowded vegetable market, I was already getting cold feet, but I couldn't give up halfway.

On the 22nd of January, the twenty-eight th lunar month, the daughter's full moon wine is held as scheduled. I told my mother to take her daughter into the room, no one should touch. Mother also blamed me less see more strange, "others kind to see you, you have the shame not to show. " I could not persuade her, had to lock her in the room.

Of course no one comes to dinner wearing a mask, and the whole idea of using an electronic thermometer to check everyone's body temperature is just a joke between my wife and me. All in all, the day passed without a hitch.

However, as we later recalled that day, my wife suddenly mentioned that one of the guests at our table had just returned from Wuhan, and that was her cousin.

The breeze of the butterfly beat grew stronger and stronger.

January 23rd

When the full moon wine was over, my wife and daughter went back to their mother's house. The countryside was not in a good condition, and things were not ready for me to take care of the children. I was left to clean up and pay the bill in my hometown by myself. I was ready to go the next day after I had packed up properly, we agreed to buy a birthday cake for my wife's second brother the next day to celebrate his birthday.

The next day, January 23, the day before New Year's Eve, I packed up and was ready to go. At that time, news reports said that the epidemic was already very serious. Wuhan was closed for the first time in history. I suddenly thought of SARS in 2003, when I was a freshman in high school, the school was closed, and I couldn't go out, and I couldn't go home. The News of the epidemic was on TV in the canteen. However, at that time, the main battlefield of the epidemic was not in Hubei, nor was Hubei a major disaster area, and we are in rural areas, the experience is far less profound than this time.

The News said that the main symptoms of new coronary pneumonia is fever, fatigue, cough, I touch the forehead, it seems a little hot? It doesn't look like much. Lack of energy? I don't know. Cough? I felt a tightness in my throat. Then there was the scene in the taxi, the car from Hankou, the wife's cousin at the full moon dinner, any suspicious sign of contact I had in the process, and so on. The video shows his wife smiling as she uses an electronic thermal gun to scan everyone's body temperature.

I need to take my temperature too!

So I managed to borrow a thermometer, stood at the door and took it, 36.6, my heart racing, almost jumping to report the information to my wife, but I immediately calmed down. Could it have been standing at the door blowing the wind, and the temperature was a little low, or maybe there wasn't enough time, or the thermometer was broken.

So I measured it again, measured it for a long time, took it out and looked at it, and Lo and behold, it was 37.2, just 0.1 from the fever threshold. A nervous, measure again, straight up to 37.3, that is not already a fever? Looking at each piece of information one by one, I became more and more nervous, and my legs began to soften.

His wife was nervous, too, but said calmly, isn't she a little overdressed. At that time I took a bath the day before because of the autumn clothes, not with more, so put the long down jacket in short down jacket outside, equivalent to wearing two down jacket. I immediately took off my short down jacket, and the next thing I knew, it was 37.2. Oh, no. Did I just fall for that? I don't seem to have fatigue or a cough.

I consulted with a friend of mine who works at the hospital, and he advised me to keep him under observation. So I decided right away not to go back, a person in the countryside isolation. Although the wife did not give up, but considering the family has two old people, three children, a large family, also helpless.

So I began a 20-day isolation of one person.

At this point, the butterfly fan hurricane has swept everyone, no one can stay out of the way.

A person's isolation

Now I can write this blog in relative peace, but I still feel scared, even though the 14-day incubation period mentioned in the news is long gone, let's take a closer look from the day I met my wife's cousin, it's been 14 days, and even though the maximum incubation period of 24 days recently announced by Academician Zhong Nanshan is just over, I'm not taking it lightly.

These days, I pay close attention to my body changes every day, every morning, noon and evening take countless times body temperature, again and again to confirm that I am OK, even a cough, a dizzy, occasionally a diarrhea, can cause me infinite suspicion. I was so scared, I couldn't imagine, if I was taken, then the people I was in close contact with, my mother-in-law, my mother, my wife, my daughter, and so many others in the village, if I was taken, I would be a sinner for all eternity!

Fortunately, these days have passed, my family and I are all right, for several days a little heart hanging down.

Seeing the increasingly severe epidemic, the county began to close the highway, the village also began to close the road, Card field, also have the village committee staff to take my temperature, every day on the road there is a propaganda car broadcast back and forth. The daily increase in the number of infections in the county was enough to make people shudder, and the New Year passed with such trepidation.

Life and death, it happens every day. Some people downplay it, and some people end up losing their lives. I can not imagine the despair and helplessness behind every letter of help, and the news that someone I know or someone close to me is sick. It is so true, but I have never felt so weak, you have to press the forward button again and again. The mood also once followed the news report innumerable times to have been angry, to have been sad, to have been moved, time and time again deeply felt "life like ants" as small and powerless.

If there is a Guan Yin in the world, Save Them.

In one video, a middle-aged woman chases after an ambulance carrying her mother, who died after medical treatment failed. On New Year's Eve, if it had not been for this sudden disaster, they might have sat together, laughing and making noise, as they usually do in many ordinary families.

And the diary written by the girl from Wuhan, "My mother is not even a number. I can't let my father become a number again. " "This family photo, we can't lose anyone else. " In this epidemic, she lost her parents. She's infected herself. Is She okay now?

Those who usually in a hurry to open the door, think it is just a normal but out of the door, but will never come back. Those who smile and pass by, feel where to see but still can not remember the name of the person, so never see again.

Now that I have a daughter and have a father, I can not look at this kind of grief-stricken things, see only infinite sorrow. I was isolated in the countryside, and my only consolation was to video-chat with my wife and see my little girl, who was barely three months old and extremely delicate, but had already been hospitalized twice for pneumonia. My wife and mother-in-law watched her day and night. A cough would keep her up all night. My mother-in-law's eyes were red. I felt ashamed to be a husband and a father when I saw the video of them pining.

That night, my wife sent me a photo of my little girl grinning. It was the first time I had actually seen her smile. The baby pure bright smile, as if the spring breeze is blowing in my heart. New Life is thriving. Yes, when spring comes, we may not see it yet, but it has come quietly. Right now, we're just being patient.

February 11,2020

-END-

By Lou Zhimin, young author.

A still from "birthday. "
